title: Unit 2 Comprehensive Quiz: Data Wrangling, Cleaning & Preparation

questions.text: Which technique for handling large datasets involves processing data one sample at a time as it arrives?
questions.explanation: Online Learning processes data incrementally, one sample or a very small batch at a time, making it suitable for streams or very large datasets.

questions.text: The `melt()` function in Pandas is used to transform data from a long format to a wide format.
questions.explanation: `melt()` transforms data from a wide format to a long format. `pivot()` or `pivot_table()` are used to go from long to wide.

questions.text: Which of the following are common steps in the Data Wrangling process? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Discovery, Cleaning, Structuring, Enrichment, Validation, and Publishing are key steps. Model Deployment is typically part of the broader Data Science process after wrangling.

questions.text: What is the primary difference between `.dropna()` and `.fillna()` in Pandas?

options.text: `.dropna()` works on Series, `.fillna()` works on DataFrames.
`.dropna()` removes missing values, while `.fillna()` replaces them.
`.dropna()` is for numerical data, `.fillna()` is for categorical data.
`.dropna()` modifies the DataFrame in place, `.fillna()` does not.

questions.explanation: `.dropna()` removes rows/columns with NaNs, while `.fillna()` fills NaNs with specified values or methods.

questions.text: Equal-width binning is generally more robust to outliers than equal-frequency binning.
questions.explanation: Equal-frequency (quantile) binning is more robust to outliers because bin widths adjust to the data distribution, whereas equal-width bins can be skewed by extreme values.

questions.text: Which Python string method removes leading and trailing whitespace from a string?
questions.explanation: `.strip()` removes whitespace from both the beginning and end of a string.

questions.text: Standardization (Z-score scaling) transforms features to have:

options.text: A mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1.
A median of 0 and an IQR of 1.

questions.explanation: Standardization rescales data so that it has a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1.
